cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MA, cs.DC, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with distributed reinforcement learning, which is a subfield of machine learning. The focus is on reducing communication overhead in distributed systems, which suggests that the paper may belong to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. However, the paper also discusses multi-agent reinforcement learning and optimal coordination strategies, which are topics typically found in the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) and Multi-Agent Systems (cs.MA) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper proposes a novel policy gradient method, which is a popular technique in the field of deep learning, suggesting that the paper may also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the convergence rate of the proposed algorithm, which is a topic typically found in the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MA, cs.DC, and cs.SY, in that order.
